Crocodiles can be found in the Kharidian Desert. They inhabit the river and both banks of the River Elid south west of Pollnivneach, north of Sophanem, and west of Nardah. Nardah and Sophanem both have banks, although the Sophanem bank is only available for players who have completed the quest Contact!. These crocodiles are found in areas where desert heat is present and thus require players to have a water source to avoid taking damage from thirst, or completion of the Crocodile Tears quest.

Weaker crocodiles infest the area east of Sophanem, along the south coast and in the eastern marshes. These crocodiles drop big bones instead of standard bones, and may occasionally drop long bones and curved bones. The marshes are not affected by desert heat, so crocodiles can be killed here for those who do not wish to deal with it.

Killing crocodiles can also be assigned as a City Quest in Menaphos.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
North of Sophanem77None28Maplink
East of Sophanem40None17Maplink

Strategy[edit | edit source]

  • Magic attacks work well, with the crocodiles taking damage with nearly every hit. However, it's best to mage the closest crocodiles. If you try to mage the ones further away, they may retreat beyond your range and it'll be extremely difficult to close in on the one you were fighting.
  • Players may want to kill crocodiles in the marshes to the east of Sophanem, as most of the marshes are not affected by desert heat. If water is used, there is a stream north by the nearby archaeologists where waterskins can be filled.
  • Waterskins are recommended when fighting crocodiles in the desert. Waterskins can be refilled in various places, such as in Pollnivneach at the fountain or at the well using a bucket. The enchanted water tiara, which can be made after completing the Dealing with Scabaras quest, can be stocked up with water runes and used as a water source against desert heat.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.
Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Key token1RareNot soldNot alchemisable
Mimic kill token (m)11/10,00095,216Not alchemisable

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • hidden 4 January 2022 (Update):
    • Graphically updated.
  • ninja 1 March 2021 (Update):
    • Crocodiles east of Sophanem have had their HP halved. Hope they don't get too snappy about it.
  • patch 5 June 2017 (Update):
    • Camels, crocodiles, Giant lizards, vultures, jackals, locusts and scarabs have been graphically updated.
    • This update added the ability to talk with them.
    • River Elid crocodiles are buffed from level 40 to level 77.
    • Crocodiles can no longer walk over the River Elid.
  • patch 9 November 2015 (Update):
    • Crocodile tails have been made longer.
  • update 2 January 2008 (Update):
    • Updated crocodiles to create a snappy and sharp(toothed) new look.
  • update 4 April 2005 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The examine text is a reference to the song "Never Smile at a Crocodile", used in Disney's 1953 film Peter Pan.
  • Crocodiles were originally able to walk over the river. While in the river, they could only be damaged with ranged or magic, or a halberd while close to the shore. However, as with most monsters, attacking them would cause them to walk over to the player to attack them. If a crocodile died while in the river, its drops would not appear.
  • Crocodiles east of Sophanem used to be stronger than those found elsewhere, and were the only ones to drop big bones. After the Evolution of Combat update, all crocodiles became the same level and are identical in combat. After the release of Menaphos, the Crocodiles found along the River Elid were buffed, while those east of Sophanem remained unchanged, meaning the river crocodiles are now the strongest. The crocodiles east of Sophanem were subsequently made even weaker in 2021.
